result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kyle L. McGeshick

records.addlTxt: 1:32 PM Prosecuting attorney Alexander Paul Seifert in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Kyle L. McGeshick in court.  Attorney John Zich appeared by video for Kyle L. McGeshick. State here for PH and calls Det. Sgt. Darrell Wilson. Sworn in 1:32 PM. State directs. Proper identification of the defendant, 1:38 PM. Cross-examination by Zich, 1:38 PM. Witness excused, 1:40 PM. State calls Det. Sgt. Anthony Crum. Sworn in 1:41 PM. State directs. Witness excused, 1:42 PM. Court based on testimony, finds probable cause and binds over for trial. Information has been filed. Attorney Zich has received a copy of information, will proceed to ARGN, waives reading of information and enters NG pleas. Court accepts pleas, continues bond and will have set for JT.

10:16 AM Prosecuting attorney Alexander Paul Seifert in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Kyle L. McGeshick in court.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court.  Attorney John Zich appeared by video for Kyle L. McGeshick. McGeshick and Zich have complaint, waives reading of it, requests PH but will waive time limits for it if Court cannot fit it in within the time limits. Court continues bond, sets for PH on 7/20/22 at 1:30 PM.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 20, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Preliminary hearing on July 20, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: No consumption of alcohol. No entry into any bars or taverns.

10:02 AM Prosecuting attorney Alexander Paul Seifert in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Kyle L. McGeshick appeared by video, in custody, in FC jail. Attorney John Zich appears by video. Criminal complaint has just been filed. Zich has not had the opportunity to review the complaint. Court reads charges and penalties. Court will have set for AIA. Zich would like to be heard on bond, makes argument and asks for $150 cash bond for reasons as stated on the record. McGeshick makes statement. Court questions employment. State requests $2000 signature bond, no consumption of alcohol, no entry into any bars or taverns. Zich does not object. Court will imposes $2000 signature bond, with condition of no consumption of alcohol and no entry into any bars or taverns.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for July 6, 2022 at 10:15 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on July 6, 2022 at 10:15 am.
